intro: Linaria lindbergiana, commonly known as Lindberg's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are tubular and arranged in racemes, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Linaria lindbergiana prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens and borders.
